## Authoring

As [noted](index.html), you can compose your quarto code notebooks in **VS Code, RStudio, Jupyter, Neovim, or a text editor**.

### Getting Started

The [Quarto getting started page](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/) provides customized instructions based on the editor you use and the [Quarto authoring tutorial](https://quarto.org/docs/get-started/authoring) shows you how to begin composing your reports.

Below, I recommend this excellent *how-to* video by @cetinkaya-rundel2023 demonstrating the workflow of scientific writing supported with Quarto:

### Publishing

Using the command line terminal, type: `quarto publish` and choose your publish target (i.e. GitHub Pages, Netlify, Quarto.pub, Posit Connect, or Other services.) The Quarto [publish documentation](https://quarto.org/docs/publishing/) explains the details.

::: {.callout-note icon="false"}
## Terminal

`quarto publish`
:::

## Introduction to reproducible Research Practices

I believe one of the values of Quarto is being able to easily practice reproducibility principles using an intuitive and well documented workflow. To learn more about reproducibility see @little2022
